page.title: 10ORIENTEERING
page.content: Beecraigs County Park with its easy access and excellent facilities makes it an ideal place to enjoy, orienteering both for training and competing. The forest is possibly rather tough in places to encourage cutting through therefore causing too much use of paths. The parking facilities and general availability to possible start and finish areas are excellent. The terrain in the park itself is,as explained earlier, excellent for the young and less experienced orienteer but possibly not technical enough for the top class orienteer although the inclusion of the Riccarton Hills has given many more options to test the ability of orienteers of all standards. The scope for variety is very good indeed.
